Content-Type: text/plain;
 charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

 
This is an error in the integrator (CVode).  CVode is trying to reduce
the time
step of the integration past the minimum step size as a means to
control the
integration error.  This can be fixed, by possibly reducing the minimum
timestep
or by increasing the magnitude of the integration tolerances.   
 
The reactorNet class  (../Cantera/src/zeroD/ReactorNet.h) has method
(member function)
setTolerances(rtol, atol), to change the absolute and relative
tolerances of all variables in
the system, unfortunately it does not have a method to change the
tolerances for each 
variable seperately or to change the minimum time step.
 
This functionality is in the integrator (ReactorNet::m_integ,
../Cantera/src/CVode.h), but m_integ
is protected.  If you provided a method in the ReactorNet, 
(  const Integrator* Reactor::integrator(){ return m_integ; }  )
to give public access to the integrator then you could experiment with
the various parameters directly.
 
ReactorNet::globalComponentIndex() might also be useful to extract the
indices of the variables of the
solution vector.
 
hope this is of some help, you might also check the CVode documentation
and newsgroup 
(CVode is currently part of the SUNDIALS package)
 
Dave H.

>>> danielexr@... 8/11/2006 11:16:41 AM >>>

Hi, professor Goodwin.
I'm simulating a channel of automotive catalytic converter.
I'm studying the fluidynamics of the channel through Fluent 6.2.16,
Linux, and for each face of the channel wall it's called Cantera, from
fluent's "udf", looping over wall faces.
I modeled the surface reactions with an "interface kinetics".
I'm sending as input for the Cantera module: temperature of gas and
wall, the species concentrations Yi  and the coverages of rhodium and
platinum.
I do advanceCoverages(dt) with dt=1, that is a time advance long
enough to get the equilibrium.
Sometimes, for some settings of inputs, i get the error message
"..failed repeatedly or with |h| = hmin", when the Cantera function is
called automatically by fluent.
But, if i try to manually run the Cantera function with the same
inputs, i don't get the error.
Can you help me, please? Is it known a malfuctioning of cantera if
called within the fluent/linux environment?
Thanks a lot.









Yahoo! Groups Links









--=__PartEBCE467B.0__=
